Class RoutingTableEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • RoutingTableEntry

  • public class RoutingTableEntry
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an entry in the routing table.
    Author:
    Mark
    See Also:
    IPAddress

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      RoutingTableEntry()
      Creates a new default destinationip IPAddress, and a new empty portCode String

      Sets the destinationip and portCode to their respective parameters.

      java.lang.String searchForPort(IPAddress ip)

    • Constructor Detail

      • RoutingTableEntry

        public RoutingTableEntry()
        Creates a new default destinationip IPAddress, and a new empty portCode String

    • Method Detail

      • addEntry

        public void addEntry(IPAddress ip,
                     java.lang.String port)
        Sets the destinationip and portCode to their respective parameters.
        Parameters:
        ip - The destination IP Address
        port - The port code (ex. e0)

      • searchForPort

        public java.lang.String searchForPort(IPAddress ip)
        This method compares the destination IP address in this routing table entry to the parameter passed to it.
        Parameters:
        ip - The NETWORK IPAddress to check this entry's IP against
        Returns:
        The port if they are equal, (example: e0) or null.

      • getPort

        public java.lang.String getPort()
        Returns:
        The port code.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String containing the IP, the subnet mask, and the port to reach that IP.
        Example: "192.168.12.32 /24 e0"
